user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_quiesce_daemon:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN MHD_socket
MHD_quiesce_daemon (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  unsigned int i;
#endif
  MHD_socket ret;

  ret = daemon->listen_fd;
  if ((MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == ret)
      || daemon->was_quiesced)
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  if ( (0 == (daemon->options & (MHD_USE_ITC))) &&
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Using MHD_quiesce_daemon in this mode " \
                 "requires MHD_USE_ITC.\n"));
#endif
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  }

#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  if (NULL != daemon->worker_pool)
    for (i = 0; i < daemon->worker_pool_size; i++)
    {
      daemon->worker_pool[i].was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
      if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
          (-1 != daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd) &&
          (daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll) )
      {
        if (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd,
                            EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                            ret,
                            NULL))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n"));
        daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
      }
      else
#endif
      if (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc))
      {
        if (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc, "q"))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                        "communication channel.\n"));
      }
    }
#endif
  daemon->was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
      (-1 != daemon->epoll_fd) &&
      (daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll) )
  {
    if ( (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->epoll_fd,
                          EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                          ret,
                          NULL)) &&
         (ENOENT != errno) )   /* ENOENT can happen due to race with
                                  #MHD_epoll() */
      MHD_PANIC ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n");
    daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
  }
#endif
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "q")) )
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                  "communication channel.\n"));
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_quiesce_daemon:
#define MHD_PANIC(msg) do{mhd_panic(mhd_panic_cls,__FILE__,__LINE__,msg);BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED;}while(0)
...
void
MHD_DLOG (const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
          const char *format,
          ...)
{
  va_list va;

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_ERROR_LOG))
    return;
  va_start (va, format);
  daemon->custom_error_log (daemon->custom_error_log_cls,
                            format,
                            va);
  va_end (va);
}
...
#define MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_(itc) (-1!=((itc).fd))
...
#define MHD_itc_activate_(itc, str) ((write((itc).fd,(constvoid*)&_MHD_itc_wr_data,sizeof(_MHD_itc_wr_data))>0)||(EAGAIN==errno))
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_(d) (0!=((d)->options&MHD_USE_EPOLL))
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_(d) (0!=(d->options&(MHD_USE_INTERNAL_POLLING_THREAD)))
...
#define MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS 1
...
#define EPOLL_SUPPORT 1
...
#define HAVE_MESSAGES 1
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc, "q"))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                        "communication channel.\n"));
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. The 'if (! MHD_itc_activate_(...)) MHD_PANIC(...)' branch is reachable (e.g. write() can fail with errno != EAGAIN), so the panic path is a reachable error path. Although MHD_PANIC expands to include BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED (indicating it does not return), that only affects control flow when the error occurs — it does not create permanently unreachable code elsewhere in the project. Therefore Rule 2.1 is not violated for this fragment.
